text:
58 yo M with hx of polysubstance abuse (ethanol, heroin, crack) and HCV
   infection p/w ETOH withdrawal and (? new-onset) AF w/ RVR. Remains
   tremulous and agitated with increased Valium requirements overnight.
   Received 180 IV valium since MN--changed to PO valium this am.
   Receiving PO dilt for rate control.
   Alcohol withdrawal (including delirium tremens, DTs, seizures)
   Assessment:
   Received pt sleeping with CIWA 9 with moderate anxiety, tremors and
   sweats, otherwise denies other s&s of withdrawal. Remains tachycardic
   with hr in low 100s in am when CIWA <10, up to as high as 150a changing
   from afib to aflutter by 11am confirmed by 12 lead ekg. Md team aware.
   too tremulous to feed self requiring assist with clear liquids-taking
   small amts when awake. T max 99.8po. oriented x3, cooperative but
   moderately restless at times.
   Action:
   Valium changed to 10mg po- given at 8am and 10:30am for CIWA >10. pt
   was calm and cooperative first few hours of shift. Oob to chair with 2
   assist for approx 20 minutes but then pt attempting to get out of
   chair, restless-hr up to 150s in aflutter around 11am. Pt was placed
   back to bed, given 10mg iv valium with good effect for a few hours.
   Noted left piv infiltrated, pulled. Unable to get another iv access
   with multiple attempts. Iv rn also unable. Dr. [**First Name (STitle) **] placed left ej
   #18g piv. Pt ordered a picc placement under guided ultrasound.
   Maintained bilateral wrist restraints d/t attempting to pull at lines
   in sleep. Bed alarm on with 4 side rails up for safety.
   Response:
   Continues with active signs of withdrawal now requiring increased doses
   iv valium with frequent ciwa checks q15minutes. Minimal access: ej.
   Awaiting picc placement.
   Plan:
   Continue CIWA scale q15 minutes, valium 10-20mg iv as needed. Continue
   safety precautions.
   18:30: given another 20mg iv valium for ciwa 16. md aware of frequent
   need for valium. Pt ordered 20mg po valium x1. given at 18:55 for ciwa
   >10. monitor effect.
